attributes.title: The Future of Design
attributes.content: Design is evolving at an unprecedented pace. New technologies, changing user behaviors, and shifting cultural contexts all contribute to how we approach visual communication today. The tools we use are more powerful than ever, but the fundamental principles of good design remain constant. Understanding this balance between innovation and tradition is crucial for any modern designer. But at the heart of it all, design will always be about solving problems and creating meaningful connections between people and ideas.

attributes.title: A Brief History of Typography
attributes.content: Typography has been fundamental to human communication for millennia. From ancient carved inscriptions to Gutenberg's revolutionary printing press, the evolution of letterforms reflects our cultural and technological progress. The Renaissance brought new attention to type design as an art form. Craftsmen like Claude Garamond and Giambattista Bodoni created typefaces that remain influential today. The Industrial Revolution introduced mechanical typesetting, dramatically increasing production speed. The 20th century saw an explosion of typographic innovation. Movements like Bauhaus championed functional, geometric sans-serif designs. The digital age has democratized typography, giving everyone access to thousands of fonts. Yet the fundamental principles of good typography - legibility, hierarchy, and aesthetic harmony - remain as important as ever. Understanding these principles helps us communicate more effectively in any medium.

validationRules.block_id: Required. Unique identifier for the block.
validationRules.content: Required. Main paragraph text content. Can include HTML for formatting (links, lists, etc.).
validationRules.Showtitle: Boolean. Controls visibility of optional title. Default: true.
validationRules.title: Conditional - required if Showtitle: true. Heading text above paragraph.
validationRules.titleTag: HTML heading tag for title. Values: 'h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6'. Default: 'h3'.
validationRules.descTag: HTML tag for content wrapper. Values: 'p', 'div', 'span'. Default: 'p'. Use 'div' for lists.
validationRules.textTypo: Typography object for paragraph text. Requires openTypography: 1 to enable.
validationRules.textColor: Hex/rgba color for paragraph text. Applied to all content.
validationRules.linkColor: Color for <a> links within content. Requires links in content.
validationRules.linkHoverColor: Hover color for links. Works with linkColor.
validationRules.dropCap: Boolean. Enable drop cap (enlarged first letter). Default: false.
validationRules.dcapView: Drop cap style. Values: '' (default), 'stacked' (background box), 'framed' (border). Requires dropCap: true.
validationRules.dcapCol: Drop cap color. For default/framed: text color. For stacked: background color.
validationRules.dcapseCol: Secondary color. For stacked: text color. For framed: background color.
validationRules.tcapspac: Drop cap margin-right in px. Recommended: 8-15px.
validationRules.tcapSize: Drop cap padding in px. For stacked/framed. Recommended: 10-20px.
validationRules.tcapbrad: Border radius in px for framed drop cap. Recommended: 5-10px.
validationRules.boWidth: Border width object for framed drop cap. Responsive with top/right/bottom/left.
validationRules.pCol: Number of CSS columns. Responsive (md/sm/xs). Values: 1-4. Desktop only recommended.
validationRules.ulMargin: Margin for <ul> and <ol> lists. Responsive object with top/right/bottom/left.
validationRules.ulPadding: Padding for <ul> and <ol> lists. Responsive object with top/right/bottom/left.
validationRules.titleBtmSpace: Space below title in px. Responsive. Recommended: 15-30px.
validationRules.textShadow: Text shadow object for paragraph. Requires openShadow: 1.
validationRules.titleShadow: Text shadow for title. Requires Showtitle: true and openShadow: 1.

warnings: CRITICAL: Never modify or regenerate block_id - causes blocks to break.

Drop cap (dropCap: true) only affects first

tag's first letter. Won't work with descTag: 'span'.
Multi-column layout (pCol > 1) can break on narrow screens. Always set sm: 1, xs: 1 for mobile.
dcapView: 'stacked' requires both dcapCol (background) and dcapseCol (text color) to be visible.
dcapView: 'framed' requires boWidth to be set for border to appear.
Links in content require proper <a> tags. linkColor/linkHoverColor only style <a> elements.
titleTypo only works when Showtitle: true. Otherwise ignored.

descTag: 'p' wraps content in

tag. Use 'div' for content with lists/complex HTML.
textTypo.openTypography must be 1 to enable typography controls. Default: 0.
Column count (pCol) doesn't work in older browsers (pre-2011). Gracefully degrades to single column.
textShadow with large blur values (>10px) can impact text readability. Use sparingly.
alignment: 'justify' can create awkward spacing on narrow screens. Use left/center for mobile.
ulMargin/ulPadding use !important - will override child block styles.
Drop cap with very large tcapspac (>20px) can create awkward text wrapping.
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 when defining textTypo or titleTypo (no effect)
Setting dropCap: true but not setting dcapCol (drop cap appears in default text color)
Using dcapView: 'stacked' without dcapseCol (white text on white background, invisible)
Setting pCol > 1 on all breakpoints (mobile text in tiny columns, unreadable)

Using descTag: 'p' with list content (creates invalid HTML:

    ...)
Setting linkColor but not having any <a> tags in content (no effect)
Forgetting to set Showtitle: false when no title wanted (empty heading appears)
Setting titleBtmSpace when Showtitle: false (no effect, spacing not applied)
Using boWidth without setting dcapView: 'framed' (border ignored)
Setting tcapSize/tcapbrad without dropCap: true (no effect)
Using very small pcolspac (<15px) with multi-column (columns too cramped)
Setting openShadow: 1 in textShadow but leaving default values (unwanted shadow appears)
Using alignment: 'justify' with short content (awkward spacing)
Forgetting responsive values for pCol (3 columns on mobile = unreadable)
bestPractices: Always set responsive alignment: md/sm/xs for optimal mobile experience
For drop caps, use tcapspac: 10-15px for balanced spacing between letter and text
Multi-column layouts: set pCol to 2-3 on desktop (md), 1 on mobile (xs) for readability
Column gap: 25-40px on desktop provides good separation without breaking flow
For magazine layouts, use alignment: 'justify' on desktop, 'left' on mobile
Drop cap stacked style: use contrasting colors (dark background, light text or vice versa)
Drop cap framed style: border width 2-4px works best, avoid thicker borders
Title spacing: 15-25px bottom margin creates good visual separation
Link colors: ensure sufficient contrast (WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum) against background
Hover colors: should be noticeably different (20-30% darker/lighter) for feedback
Text shadows: keep blur small (2-4px) and low opacity (0.1-0.3) for subtlety
List spacing: ulMargin left: 20px, ulPadding left: 15px creates standard indentation
For quotes/testimonials: use italic font style, center alignment, larger size (20-24px)
Typography size: 16-18px body text on desktop, 14-16px on mobile for readability
Line height: 1.5-1.7 for body text provides comfortable reading experience
Always test multi-column on actual devices - columns can break unexpectedly

CSS ::first-letter pseudo-element targets first

tag's first character

layoutContext.responsiveStrategy: Typography sizes, alignment, and column count all support responsive (md/sm/xs) breakpoints

performanceConsiderations: Text shadows (textShadow) can impact rendering performance with many paragraphs on page
Multi-column layouts (pCol > 1) trigger additional layout calculations - limit use on mobile
Drop caps with complex styling (stacked/framed) add minimal overhead - safe to use freely
Link hover effects require repaints - not a concern for normal usage
Very long paragraphs (>2000 words) with multi-column can cause layout thrashing on scroll
Custom list spacing (ulMargin/ulPadding) uses !important - can't be overridden by child styles
accessibilityNotes: Use semantic titleTag (h1-h6) in proper hierarchy - h1 for main title, h2 for sections, etc.
Don't skip heading levels (h2 â†’ h4) - screen readers use heading hierarchy for navigation
Ensure link colors (linkColor) have sufficient contrast against textColor (4.5:1 minimum)
Drop caps are decorative - ensure first letter is still readable by screen readers (it is)
Multi-column text can confuse screen readers - content read sequentially, not column-by-column
Text shadows should not be the only way to distinguish text - ensure color contrast still good
alignment: 'justify' can create awkward spacing for dyslexic readers - use left-align for accessibility
Ensure interactive elements (links) are clearly distinguishable through color AND underline/styling
